rename.from: v0.10.9 Status disappears when the windows gets smaller
rename.to: v0.10.9 Status disappears when the window gets smaller

body:
I can remove the "hidden-xs" and make pull request, if accepted.

The folder and device names simply break line if too long. (That is different to the additional info) 

![unbenannt](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5316618/375538c0-7cd1-11e4-8a6e-b6ca49e6bd11.PNG)

Maybe we can come up with something better instead of the text info?
On smaller devices I suggest to remove the glyphicon/identicon to save space and on the right use a simple square as an indicator colored according to the current status
![folder indicator](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9367272/5319738/3997980a-7cac-11e4-9b39-79c414e2d686.png)

I made some:
![unbenannt2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5326043/4aef585a-7d46-11e4-8c5d-add046182a0e.PNG)
![unbenannt3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5326044/4babc0b2-7d46-11e4-89cc-0b8657c4e0ec.PNG)
![unbenannt4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5326045/4ce45520-7d46-11e4-8156-fb7fae061256.PNG)
I personally like the symbol next the folder name.

Looks nice. We could skip the symbols, as in the last example, perhaps if we added headers for sections. I.e. an `

Folders

` or something in between?

issue.title: Difference between gui of android and linux

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
When i start syncthing 0.10.11+15 on my linux pc i can see the following picture:

![2014 12 09-syncthing-0 10 11 15-linux](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9266434/5357424/c14ffcc6-7fa7-11e4-8d1c-3c551349bbee.png)

After i start syncthing 0.5.12 on my handy the following picture is shown:

![2014 12 09-syncthing-0 5 12-android](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9266434/5357453/0511e866-7fa8-11e4-8007-b24851ff0f08.png)

On the gui of the pc i can read "Syncing (44%)
On the gui of android there is nothing equivalence

For the overwritte text on the gui of android there is an issues #944.

Thanks for your work on syncthing!

body:
I added the h3 header: ![asdasd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5630129/3253f7e4-95fe-11e4-8020-1d98d0416e61.PNG) I tried to add the CSS mentioned by @uok and i added the following code: ```

 {{folder.ID}} Unknown Unshared Stopped Scanning Up to Date Syncing ({{syncPercentage(folder.ID)}}%) ◼ ◼ ◼ ◼ ◼ ◼

``` FireFox: ![firefoxwin7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5629948/7ccd4408-95fc-11e4-9068-e1d330616720.PNG) IE7: ![iewin7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5629949/7e84172c-95fc-11e4-8820-cfcf35b8c0bf.PNG) So it seems the "nowarp" does not what it should.. without the "nowarp": (This seems more desirable for me) FireFox: ![firefoxwin7_nonowrap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5629986/e624a02c-95fc-11e4-992e-723b3014751c.PNG) IE7: ![iewin7_nonowrap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5629987/eb669540-95fc-11e4-968b-2f4d548991ce.PNG) Because I donÂ´t want that space, when we are in the small gui, I changed the above code: from: ```  {{folder.ID}}" ``` to: ```  {{folder.ID}}" ``` This happens: Again FireFox first: ![firefoxwin7_hiddenspace1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5630053/8d984c28-95fd-11e4-9551-0207d159993e.PNG) ![firefoxwin7_hiddenspace2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5630054/90ce65e4-95fd-11e4-9aef-48baafcb50fa.PNG) So all looks fine. But IE: ![iewin7_hiddenspace1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5630059/9c10dc16-95fd-11e4-8faa-ee276c7235e6.PNG) ![iewin7_hiddenspace2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7719800/5630063/a076e9ee-95fd-11e4-9060-06e1784755bb.PNG) My questions would be: - What about the space situation. - The way I made the hidden box, is that ok? (with the double text, or can this be done more elegant?) You can see my changes in https://github.com/bigbear2nd/syncthing/commit/a4042a945363cf5c8cb4fd7a9cd9f359caa25df7
@bigbear2nd : thanks for trying my idea and the screenshots my suggestion to keep the code clean ``` Unknown◼ Unshared◼ ``` so each status has a single line instead of two "duplicate" big spans

I am truly sorry for the above commit and merge + revert nonsense.
Something went wrong with the rebase commands.. I fail to understand git.

Please feel free to use any lines of code from 
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/commit/36a6e13fc0c2689c8bb709dee279544ca58f4974
this was working in IE and FireFox the best. 
I hope someone can delete all the nonsense. I tried to delete my fork, but the comments here stay..

Sorry but I am completely puzzled about where your commit is.
Can you just commit it to your repo and make a pull request?
You can squash, rebase and amend to get rid of unnecessary commits and messages.

Again, i am sorry for all the unnecessary git references. I am still very unfamiliar with all the commiting, squashing and git itself.

I created the section headers as @calmh suggested, but the word "devices" is not in the translation list yet. How can I enter this there?

As long as the translate-attribute is set it should be fine. AFAIK @calmh has some script magic in the background that creates the necessary string file which is then pulled by transifex and again pulled back to github together with a new release :tada:
